description: A medium-sized, all-white cockatoo with a small recumbent crest and a pale blue eye-ring. They are known for being more gentle and less demanding than other cockatoos.
temperament: Playful, gentle, and relatively quiet for a cockatoo. They are known to be very friendly and less prone to biting or neurotic behaviors than many of their cousins.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. While quieter than the large cockatoos, they can still produce a loud screech when they want to.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for their talking ability, but they are intelligent and can learn some words. Their calls are generally less harsh than other cockatoos.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of pellets, fresh vegetables, and some fruit. They are active birds and can be good eaters.
healthPointers: Generally a hardy species with a lifespan of 40+ years. They still produce feather dust and need regular bathing. PBFD is a concern for all cockatoos.
housing: May be suitable for some apartment situations due to their more moderate noise level. They are active and need a spacious cage, minimum 30"W x 22"D x 40"H.
